Author: jorian#4555
Content:
why does `getrawtransaction` give ```"vout": [
    {
      "value": 12.00990000,
      "valueSat": 1200990000,
``` and `decoderawtransaction` give ```
  "vout": [
    {
      "value": 12.00990000,
      "valueZat": 1200990000,
```? what is the difference between Sat and Zat?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: "value" vs "valueZat"

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: both there for backward compatibility. NEVER BREAK USERSPACE!

Author: jorian#4555
Content: yes, ok, as i can understand its need, i don't understand why the first one is Sat and the second is Zat

Author: jorian#4555
Content: what is Zat

Author: jorian#4555
Content: Zatoshis?

Author: jorian#4555
Content: maybe i should ask zcash peoples

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: maybe it is a typo

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jorian @jl777c Zcash calls their "satoshis" as "zatoshis", and Hush calls ours "puposhis", after Hush Puppy

Author: jorian#4555
Content: zcash doesn't use them anymore in both their decoderawtransaction and getrawtransaction

Author: jorian#4555
Content: muh muh backwards compatibility?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jorian i think the fact they are using valueSat and valueZat looks like a bug on their part, unless they added that new key to one of the RPCs recently. Maybe they didn't want to break backcompat of valueSat, but called the new key valueZat

Author: jorian#4555
Content: zcash doesn't use them anymore in both their decoderawtransaction and getrawtransaction

Author: jorian#4555
Content: see also https://zcash-rpc.github.io/decoderawtransaction.html and https://zcash-rpc.github.io/getrawtransaction.html

Author: jorian#4555
Content: not that we have to copy everything zcash does

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: just because it's not in the docs, doesn't mean it's not used anymore ğŸ˜ƒ

Author: jorian#4555
Content: mmh, would be weird, need to check that

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: there are no tests for either, i can tell you that

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: valueZat is still returned by zcash api, not valueSat

Author: dukeleto#7326
dukeleto#7326
Content: that is the only reference to that key in the entire codebase

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: zcash master codebase, that is

Author: jorian#4555
Content: interesting.. that letter is the only difference between get and decode

Author: jorian#4555
Content: at least, in KMD it is

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: zatoshi does not make sense in KMD codebase

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: almost everything in our codebase and everyone else's says `satoshi`, some people change user-facing docs/etc

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content:
```commit c66c731adf766b5085eefe0008b7c83fe02f5162
Author: Jack Grigg <jack@z.cash>
Date:   Thu May 11 18:00:15 2017

    Add a benchmark for calling ConnectBlock on a block with many inputs

    Requires placing block-107134.tar.gz (containing the block, and a fake CoinsDB
    containing its inputs) into the base directory of the repository. This can be
    generated using qa/zcash/create_benchmark_archive.py (see the script for usage
    details).

    To facilitate generation of the fake CoinsDB, an additional field 'valueZat' has
    been added to 'getrawtransaction' containing the integer number of zatoshis
    instead of a decimal number of ZEC.```

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: that is the backstory

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: seems like valueZat was a hack for an old script with no tests that nobody uses anymore

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: clean it all with ğŸ”¥

Author: jorian#4555
Content: aha, but KMD uses valueSat in getrawtransaction

Author: jorian#4555
Content: so probably someone forgot to change valueZat to valueSat in the decoderawtransaction?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: is this causing a bug of some kind?

Author: jorian#4555
Content: no, just wondered the difference.. i would need to account for the difference in my code though

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i don't think anything actually uses valueZat which was inherited from zcash

Author: dukeleto#7326
dukeleto#7326
Content: valueSat is used various places, and @Decker put his name in a comment ğŸ‰ about it

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i would say change valueZat to valueSat, but that is for James to decide. Seems to be of low importance

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: just use "value"

Author: jorian#4555
Content: yes, i'm ignoring Sat and Zat already

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: those are bad names as it is not satoshis but in floating point COINS

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but there is no way to know what code is being written that uses those fields

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and since it is no big deal to keep it around and not break anything that might have used it, i kept it in there

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: think of it as the total opposite of bitcoin core, who go out of there way to make sure they break as much as possible

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we go out of our way to keep as much working as possible

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there are enough giant changes that happen to add the burden of an ever changing JSON syntax

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: agreed, only introduce backward incompatibility rarely and strategically
